intro: Emilia transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal emilia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disc of smaller florets. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Emilia transvaalensis is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it adds a vibrant splash of color to the landscape.
